intro: Cacalia articulata, commonly known as the broken stem bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique feature is the segmented, jointed stems that give it its common name. Cacalia articulata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
